reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: TI Kenya 2020-2022; Empowering marginalized groups to participate in Public Finance Management and decision-making processes at county level

description.narrative: The project is premised on addressing gaps hindering citizen?s participation in governance and decision making processes with a focus on strengthening the capacities of the marginalized groups in their involvement in public finance management decision maki ng processes in the targeted counties. Specifically the project intends to organize marginalized groups [women youths and persons living with disabilities] and strengthen their capacities to engage in the budget making +tracking process and further establi sh clear information on county budget performance in respect to gender minority and vulnerable groups as a means to enhance advocacy for greater inclusion of these groups in planning and better impact through county expenditure for better service delivery. To further strengthen their engagement the project will encourage the involvement of women and marginalized groups in undertaking oversight through reporting of corruption related cases by creating a platform for offering legal aid advice to the victims of corruption. This will be done in partnership with legal aid providers in the targeted counties for case follow-ups and prosecution of corruption related cases.Additionally the project intends to work with County Assemblies to strengthen their capacities i n undertaking their oversight and legislative roles through the establishment and strengthening of Women Caucuses identification of male champions and establishment/strengthening of anti-corruption networks within the Assemblies that will be critical in pu shing for transparency and accountability in the management and utilization of public resources. The project will target By strengthening the capacities of the marginalized groups to meaningfully engage with the devolved government structures and further b y enhancing knowledge understanding and strengthening platforms for informed engagement the project will contribute to open stronger and accountable governance structuresmarginalized groups and selected duty bearers from Kisumu Bungoma Kakamega and Siaya Counties. The project is potentially expected to benefit a total population of 5678898 comprising of 2738882 males 2939900 females and 116 intersex. (Kisumu 560942 males 594609 females and 23 intersex; Siaya 471661 Males 521496 females and 18 intersex; B ungoma 812146 males 858389 females and 35 intersex; Kakamega 897133 males 970406 females and 40 intersex.).

To further strengthen their engagement the project will encourage the involvement of women and marginalized groups in undertaking oversight through reporting of corruption related cases by creating a platform for offering legal aid advice to the victims of corruption.
